intro: Urostachya chrysantha, commonly known as the golden sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Urostachya chrysantha is often found in sandy or gravelly habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native range.
